Company: Bay State Gas Company dba Columbia Gas of Massachusetts
Description: Columbia Gas agreed to refund $8.9 million to customers in settlement of allegations a buyout payment it received in 2006 should have been immediately returned to ratepayers, since it had already been granted a rate increase on the assumption that it was paying higher annual payments on a gas transportation contract.

Boston Edison agreed to pay $8.6 million for the cleanup of hazardous materials at the new Boston Convention and Exhibition Center, settling allegations it disposed of electrical equipment contaminated with PCBs on the property when it was a junkyard.
Connecticut Light & Power was ordered to pay refunds plus interest totalling about $8 million in judgment of charges it over-charged many municipalities for leasing streetlights.

Eversource Energy Service Co. agreed to pay $250,000 in penalties in settlement of allegations it violated the wage and hour laws when a new payroll system caused many errors. The company had already paid back all $828,000 restitution.
NSTAR agreed to pay $44.7 million in refunds to customers in settlement of several outstanding cases concerning its capital improvements, pension expenses, and energy efficiency programs.

Company: Bay State Gas Company, d/b/a Columbia Gas of Massachusetts
Description: Bay State Gas Company, d/b/a Columbia Gas of Massachusetts, agreed to pay $53 million and plead guilty to violating a minimum safety standard of the Natural Gas Pipeline Safety Act relating to the failure to implement procedures to prevent the over-pressurization of its low-pressure gas distribution system in South Lawrence during a pipe replacement project known as the South Union Project.

Company: The Connecticut Light and Power Company dba Eversource Energy
Agency: Connecticut Department of Energy & Environmental Protection
Notes: Captured from summaries produced by DEP; may not include full details of penalties.

Company: Public Service Company of New Hampshire
Agency: New Hampshire Department of Environmental Services

Description: Columbia Gas agreed to pay $143 million to settle class action litigation by thousands of Massachusetts residents and business owners affected by natural gas explosions and resulting fires in 2018.

Eversource was fined $29 million by the CT Public Utilities Regulatory Authority in a civil penalty advocated for by the Attorney General's Office, with a finding that the company failed to meet preparedness and response standards required before, during and after Tropical Storm Isaias, resulting in harm to ratepayers from storm damage and failure to provide electricity services.
The DPU ordered three utilities to pay a total of $24.8 million in penalties after finding deficiencies in their responses to Tropical Storm Irene and the October 2011 snowstorm.
Info Source: Department of Public Utilities Imposes $24.8 Million in Penalties for Utilities' 2011 Storm Responses, Targeted News Service, December 11, 2012 (via Nexis).

Description: The DPU ordered three utilities to pay a total of $24.8 million in penalties after finding deficiencies in their responses to Tropical Storm Irene and the October 2011 snowstorm.

Description: The Department of Public Utilities issued an Order approving a settlement agreement under which Columbia Gas of Massachusetts will pay $56 million for its role in the Merrimack Valley gas explosions, leave Massachusetts and transfer its assets to Eversource Energy.

Description: The company punctured a natural gas pipeline causing a gas leak at a residential property that later ignited.
